name: Beyond Plastics
text: RT @JohniHite: @recyclewasteco @kevin_budris @osynoracki @CLF @KirstiePecci @GAIAnoburn @PlasticsBeyond Agreed! I do think order of operati‚Ä¶
retweet_text: @recyclewasteco @kevin_budris @osynoracki @CLF @KirstiePecci @GAIAnoburn @PlasticsBeyond Agreed! I do think order of operations is important. Plastic industry supports pyrolysis, while also investing $202bn in new production facilities. Hard to see how support for pyrolysis isn't inextricably tied to increased production of virgin plastic. Limit, then manage.

Burning medical waste is dangerous and has no place in Rhode Island or anywhere else. No matter the process, high heat + medical waste = toxic emissions. @CLF @RIAudubon @TNC_RI @EnvCouncil_RI @HCWHGlobal @GAIAUS_CAN @ecoRI_Tim @steveahlquist

name: Beyond Plastics
text: RT @kevin_budris: @recyclewasteco @osynoracki @CLF @KirstiePecci @GAIAnoburn @PlasticsBeyond Incorrect. Most waste pyrolysis generates a di‚Ä¶
retweet_text: @recyclewasteco @osynoracki @CLF @KirstiePecci @GAIAnoburn @PlasticsBeyond Incorrect. Most waste pyrolysis generates a dirty "synthetic fuel," which is then burned. And the "char" from pyrolysis is also often burned. All of this results in a similar emissions profile to incineration: carbon dioxide, nitrogen oxides, heavy metals, dioxins, etc.

text: Thanks to @RFI_En for this thoughtful piece. The oil industry is increasingly looking for a replacement market for declining demand. "So what they have focused on is single use plastic packaging being their replacement market," says @enckj #keepitintheground #breakfreefromplastic https://t.co/g74ddBf8U4

name: Beyond Plastics
text: New test results from Dr. David Bond at @AtBennington reveal disturbing amounts of #PFAS in area around Norlite incinerator in Cohoes, NY. w/ @enckj Story from @WAMCNews @davelucas on burning #AFFF. @BenningtonCAPA  https://t.co/claFRme47G

name: Beyond Plastics
text: .@NYSDEC Chief of Staff calls it "fear-mongering" but people should be outraged by this - and AFRAID. Not only does burning #PFAS not work (it's inflammable...) it also threatens public health & the environment in the Capital Region. https://t.co/claFRme47G @davelucas @WAMCNews

name: Beyond Plastics
text: RT @theintercept: ‚ÄúWe need federal spending to go to things like more testing, contact tracing, investments in clean energy ‚Äî and not to at‚Ä¶
retweet_text: ‚ÄúWe need federal spending to go to things like more testing, contact tracing, investments in clean energy ‚Äî and not to attempts to prop up the feeble plastics recycling infrastructure,‚Äù says Judith Enck, founder of the environmental group @PlasticsBeyond. https://t.co/40RerT39KJ

name: Beyond Plastics
text: PFAS is also absorbed through the skin. It also enters soil. It also enters wells. Burning this chemical should be proven SAFE before it is done. The public should have been informed. It should not have taken a FOIA to bring this to light. https://t.co/nlT3DKMoQg

name: Beyond Plastics
text: RT @LizAGMoran: @SeanMaharUnreal @PlasticsBeyond @AtBennington @enckj Fear mongering? Seriously? Elevated #PFAS were found by the college n‚Ä¶
retweet_text: @SeanMaharUnreal @PlasticsBeyond @AtBennington @enckj Fear mongering? Seriously? Elevated #PFAS were found by the college near the facility. They posted the lab results. Why not err to the side of caution and ban incineration of PFAS at this facility? Then there'd be nothing to worry about.

name: Beyond Plastics
text: On the contrary, the information is being presented as scientific evidence. And due to the lack of NYSDEC data which SHOULD have been providing the baseline, it is the ONLY scientific evidence at this point. That is, frankly, terrifying...

name: Beyond Plastics
text:
RT @LizAGMoran: @SeanMaharUnreal @PlasticsBeyond @enckj So not keeping them from entering the environment to begin with? 

What evidence do‚Ä¶
retweet_text:
@SeanMaharUnreal @PlasticsBeyond @enckj So not keeping them from entering the environment to begin with? 

What evidence does DEC have to prove incineration of PFAS is safe? And should we be doing it if it hasn‚Äôt been proven to be safe?

name: Beyond Plastics

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "Some health agency needs to offer blood testing for residents of Saratoga Sites, the public housing facility right next to Norlite, at least. But right now there are no plans to do that that we know of." @enckj @nysdec @HealthNYGov

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "Troy, NY gets its drinking water from a reservoir that is down wind from the Norlite incinerator in Cohoes - it's about 10 miles away. We know PFAS can be found 15 miles from plastics facilities." Dr. David Bond of @AtBennington re the burning of #PFAS #AFFF foam. #noburn @enckj

Until there is clear evidence that proper incineration destroys PFAS toxins, AFFF should not be burned" #PFOA https://t.co/ZRr0bfA3zY

name: Beyond Plastics
text: Those of you who live in Cohoes should attend tomorrow (Tuesday) evening's 7 PM Zoom meeting of the Common Council to demand immediate action to prevent future burning of AFFF at Norlite. Details can be found here: https://t.co/2eRSBmcJsJ @enckj

name: Beyond Plastics
text: The Cohoes Common Council will also be meeting tomorrow and we hope that they will move quickly to block future burning at Norlite that could begin again as early as this June. @enckj

name: Beyond Plastics
text: Norlite has said they intend to resume burning PFAS-laden AFFF by June so it's urgent that our elected officials act quickly to prevent that from happening. You can urge your state legislators to pass that bill here: https://t.co/wyQNUIKt9g

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "I urge @NYSDEC to do their own testing. The narrative from them is that high temperatures destroy these chemicals but these tests indicate that that is not actually the case and the people of Troy, Cohoes & the Capital Region should NOT be guinea pigs."@enckj @BenningtonCAPA

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "Burning or burying these chemicals is really not a solution. This is the last kind of chemical that you want to blow out of a smokestack." - Dr. Jane Williams, California Communities Against Toxics #PFAS #AFFF #noburn @enckj https://t.co/RimCjUsaLl

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "The problem is that the Capital Region now has massive amounts of #AFFF heading to you. Norlite is seen by many state regulators as a great place to send it. So I can't emphasize enough how important it is for your region to take action on this." Act now: https://t.co/wyQNUIsRKG

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "These chemicals were specifically designed NOT to burn - to serve as a chemical blanket you'd toss on top of a fire to stop it from combusting." -Dr. Jane Williams https://t.co/xSphRJWQt3

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "AFFF has now become a hot potato. States know they have this incredibly toxic chemical lying around in drums in fire stations & airports and they want to get rid of it. There's a rush to burn because everyone knows burying it is a bad idea due to groundwater contamination."

name: Beyond Plastics
text: PFAS is a family of 250 compounds, of which we only know how to detect 50. This limitation means we may be seeing the tip of the iceberg as existing assays do not enable us to definitively determine the extent of the danger it poses to our health & environment. #PFAS #PFOA #AFFF

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "Far from destroying PFAS, the Norlite facility appears to be raining down a witch's brew of perfluorinated compounds on poorer neighborhoods around the facility." Dr. David Bond of @AtBennington @enckj @dunleamark #toxicplastic   #noburn #AFFF #PFAS @BenningtonCAPA https://t.co/37wYn5XfZb

name: Beyond Plastics
text: Dr. David Bond of @AtBennington has determined that it's possible to lift the particular fingerprint of AFFF to find whether it's being combusted. The team took several samples from neighborhoods that surround Norlite in Cohones, NY. Find map here: https://t.co/xSphRJWQt3

name: Beyond Plastics
text: "PFAS is the name of the large family of perfluorinated compounds. These toxic chemicals are referred to as "forever chemicals" because they do not break down in the environment. They're also highly mobile & toxic & are linked to cancer, immune dysfunction and infertility."

name: Beyond Plastics
text: Norlite began burning the AFFF (and, ironically, inflammable) material without first doing a test burn. This is beyond unacceptable. Dr. David Bond's of @atbennington test results from near the site are significant. More here: https://t.co/xSphRJWQt3 @enckj #PFAS #noburn @NYSDEC

name: Beyond Plastics
text: Norlite is one of just 4 incinerators in the country that has opted to burn toxic #PFAS laden firefighting foam & is one of, if not the largest, facility doing so. This has happened without environmental review or informing the community. https://t.co/xSphRJWQt3 @NYSDEC @enckj

name: Beyond Plastics

text: @DrAlistairDove @Craken_MacCraic @JeffBezos @amazon @milesbrignall @guardian The only plastics that have any shot of actually getting recycled are limited to #1, 2, 3 plastics (for which there's a market) And even those are only recycled 1-2 times, maximum. Plastics recycling is not a solution. And Amazon's hard to recycle packaging is a big step backward

name: Beyond Plastics
text: @DrAlistairDove @Craken_MacCraic @JeffBezos @amazon @milesbrignall @guardian Plus the larger challenge of plastic recycling these days - very little of it actually gets recycled because there are no longer int'l markets for it and it costs money. So it's a largely a myth, particularly for things like films.

name: Beyond Plastics
text: @DrAlistairDove @Craken_MacCraic @JeffBezos @amazon @milesbrignall @guardian 3 BIG problems: 1. Extra effort required means very few ppl actually drop them off, 2. People are fouling recycling loads w/ these because they think chuck them in the blue bin w/ the rest, 3. No enforcement of drop off-centers actually recycling these materials once collected.

name: Beyond Plastics
text: @LisaSJonesMove @GAIAnoburn Develop alternative delivery systems for food and other products that do not generate mountains of trash and that rely on reusable/refillable rather than single-use packaging.

name: Beyond Plastics
text: @LisaSJonesMove @GAIAnoburn Dramatically reduce production of plastics of all kinds rather than the plastics industries projections of continuing to dramatically ramp up production.

name: Beyond Plastics
text: @LisaSJonesMove @GAIAnoburn Surely. Solutions include: stop removing fossil fuels from the ground (this is a primary climate change solution, too) as plastics are a byproduct of oil and gas drilling/fracking.

name: Beyond Plastics
text: @PlanToReduce Burning "something" for fuel has led directly to our #climatecrisis. Thankfully there are effective #noburn alternative energy sources like solar, wind & hydropower. #Incineration releases toxic chemicals into our air & produces toxic ash that's a big problem. It's NOT a solution

name: Beyond Plastics
text: @PlanToReduce It's a real shame about the results for our air, water and soil from your operation. #incinerationisnotasolution @GAIAnoburn @brkfreeplastic
